author: Unreal Engine
description:
In this session recorded at Unreal Fest Orlando 2025, we explore the best practices for using Horde: a set of services from Epic Games, designed to support workflows for developing Fortnite, Unreal Engine, and other projects. 

Horde includes functionality for remote execution, build and test automation, and mobile/console device management, among other services. This talk dives into the approaches used in Fortnite and other Epic Games projects to minimize build times, build costs, build breakages, and time broken.

Learn how Epic sets up Horde for our own projects to maximize throughput and maintainability, touching on how we use author-performant build graphs, optimize resourcing, get the most from Horde's build health tool, and work with branching techniques.

Find out more about Horde in Unreal Engine here: dev.epicgames.com/documentation/unreal-engine/horde-in-unreal-engine

#Horde, #RemoteExecution, #BuildAutomation, #TestAutomation, #DeviceManagement, #UnrealEngine, #UE5, #Unre
title: How Epic Games Uses Horde to Make Builds Better | Unreal Fest Orlando 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
In this session recorded at Unreal Fest Orlando 2025, we walk you through the entire workflow for self-publishing your game on the Epic Games Store, from organization creation to pushing your 'Coming Soon' page and preparing your game for release.

Topics include onboarding, Offer setting, Page setting, Rating and Region Setting, use of the Build Patch Tool (BPT), 'Coming Soon' readiness, and release readiness.

Learn more about the Epic Games Store here: store.epicgames.com/distribution

#SelfPublishingGames, #EpicGamesStore, #BuildPatchTool, #UnrealFestOrlando
title: Self-Publishing to the Epic Games Store | Unreal Fest Orlando 2025
